image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair sits on a couch looking down at an image of a smiling young man with short dark hair.

props.synopsis: After Canberra woman Leesa Mountford's son, Josh Clarke, took his own life at 25, she co-founded grassroots support network I Got You — helping to fill a gap with demand for support services skyrocketing in the past two years.

title.children: After Josh took his life, his mum started a support network in his honour

image.altText: Man wearing sunglasses and a dark blue suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Canberra man Josh Fenwick, 29, is found guilty of raping a 16-year-old girl he took home from Civic with her friend after a night out drinking.

title.children: Canberra man found guilty of raping teen as co-accused's charge dismissed

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building with the words "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entrance.

props.synopsis: An ACT defence lawyer has accused the Director of Public Prosecutions of wasting time and money running cases with "no reasonable prospect of success".

title.children: Defence lawyer accuses ACT's top prosecutor of running 'merit-less cases'

image.altText: A group of people walk off a light rail tram.

props.synopsis: The ACT government is considering a Greens-backed plan to offer free public transport to more residents, but concerns about costs could stall the proposal.

title.children: More Canberrans could soon be able to take public transport for free

image.altText: a close-up of someone using an iphone to purchase alcohol online

props.synopsis: The ACT government introduces a bill that would restrict alcohol deliveries to Canberra homes to between 10am and 10pm, and cap the amount of alcohol a consumer could receive in a 24-hour period.

title.children: Alcohol deliveries to Canberra homes could soon be restricted

image.altText: An artist's impression of a new woden with skyscrapers

props.synopsis: A developer wants to add 17 towers to the Woden town centre with the highest proposed to stand at 55 storeys.

title.children: Canberra's tallest buildings would be dwarfed by proposed new skyscrapers

image.altText: Clinton Walker stands on a large rock in the middle of Murujuga National Park. He looks to the sky while the sun sets behind him

props.synopsis: There are more than 2 million artworks on the rocks at Murujuga, with more stories under the waves.

title.children: Ancient rock art in northern WA shows Tasmanian tiger, Tasmanian devil

image.altText: Prince Andrew looks over his shoulder while King Charles looks at him

props.synopsis: In a week where King Charles said he hoped to project unity as a "bulwark against those promoting conflict, division and tyranny", his scandal-ridden brother reigned supreme.

title.children: Charles is reluctant to evict his 'Prince Andrew problem', but William would

image.altText: A close-up view of a phone charging on a power bank

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia is reviewing its rules on portable power banks following a mid-air fire on one of its planes.

title.children: Virgin Australia reviewing power bank rules after fire on board

image.altText: Jason Sourasis and Scott Pendlebury.

props.synopsis: Former Magpies skipper Scott Pendlebury has hired one of Australia's most high-profile commercial lawyers to claim millions that he alleges his former confidant misappropriated.

title.children: How a billion-dollar dream blew up a friendship with an AFL star

image.altText: Two hands with white gloves handle gold bullion

props.synopsis: A major investment bank says gold is following share markets higher. While the precious metal consistently pushes record highs, it suggests the gold price could continue to rise substantially. But what's really at stake?

title.children: Why betting on gold puts Australia's $4 trillion super pool at risk

image.altText: A man with a dark beard sits with a serious expression with a grey haired man in the foreground

props.synopsis: The "Coalition of the Willing" talks in London aimed to increase pressure on Vladimir Putin to end Russia's war in Ukraine.

title.children: Zelenskyy calls for broader sanctions, seeks long-range missiles

image.altText: Jaimie holds a placard at a protest as she smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: From a retired anaesthetist to a garden-loving grandmother, these three older Australians have "stepped up" and into the "exhausting and stressful" protest movement.

title.children: Meet the retiree activists on a mission to tidy the 'mess' of their generation

image.altText: Navy hat in foreground clasped hands in background

props.synopsis: The class action, which was officially launched in the Federal Court on Friday, will operate on an opt-out basis.

title.children: Former servicewoman says she was threatened with rape for standing up to boss

image.altText: Donald Trump gesturing with both hands as he answers questions from reporters at the White House.

props.synopsis: The US president has used tariffs as leverage on many countries around the world.

title.children: Canada ready to resume US trade talks halted by Trump over TV ad

image.altText: Anthony Albanese takes a selfie with a smiling Donald Trump

props.synopsis: They said it, we published it. Can you decipher it? See if you can work out who said what, and why.

title.children: ABC Quote Quiz: Gifts for Trump, unpopular royals and a new-look BOM site

image.altText: Chloe Saliaris stands in the snow

props.synopsis: Australia excels in the gravity-defying winter sports discipline of aerial skiing, despite not having a single snow facility in the entire country.

title.children: 'Aussie grit' key to aerial skiing heights ahead of Winter Olympics

image.altText: Isak Andic, a middle aged man in a suit and glasses, sits front row with Kate Moss, a blonde supermodel

props.synopsis: It was a regular December day when Isak Andic, the billionaire founder of Spanish fast-fashion label Mango, set out on a hike with relatives through the Montserrat caves near Barcelona.

title.children: This billionaire fashion CEO fell to his death. Now his son is an alleged suspect

image.altText: A family of four are scattered on a dirt road, each sitting on horse back looking into the distance.

props.synopsis: Told she would never ride again after a multiple sclerosis diagnosis, horse trainer Lynda MacCallum is still defying the odds seven years later.

title.children: Lynda MacCallum is saving her life in the saddle, one hoofbeat at a time

image.altText: Generic photos of a mental health facility.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained by the ABC show a failed audit at Tasmania's only large-scale private mental health facility, claims that staff concerns were ignored, and the lead-up to the departure of its CEO.

title.children: The Hobart Clinic failed audit before funding ended and CEO sacked

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump hold up signed documents in front of flags

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump were all smiles as they inked a $3 billion critical minerals deal touted as a good deal for all. But has Australia drawn the short end of the stick?

title.children: Will Australia's $3bn critical minerals deal with Trump pay off?

image.altText: An underwater scene, showing sea urchins sitting on coral and algae species.

props.synopsis: A hidden environmental crisis lurks beneath the crystal clear waters of Australia's east coast as long-spined sea urchins wreak havoc on the coast. Now scientists are trialling a new solution.

title.children: AI robots to stop sea urchins turning seabed into 'moonscape'

image.altText: Pete Hegseth looking at the camera with a stern expression and furrowed brow.

props.synopsis: The frequency of the strikes has increased from one every few weeks in September to three in one week now.

title.children: US strikes 10th alleged drug-running boat in the Caribbean

image.altText: An emu on a road.

props.synopsis: As a "silent killer" blankets large parts of Australia's north this weekend, medical professionals urge people to plan ahead and stay hydrated.

title.children: Northern Australia urged to prepare for severe heatwave

image.altText: A yellow ballot paper inside a brown box with the Townsville city in the background.

props.synopsis: Townsville residents will select from a field of nine candidates at a mayoral by-election next month.

title.children: Townsville mayoral race heating up as candidates reveal their policies

image.altText: Emerald Ruby 2024 Artist Photos Patchwork EP Shoot HQ53

props.synopsis: Jennifer Hankin was hoping to apply for a NSW government grant program to support local recording artists so she could finally release her EP.

title.children: Condition in government's grant program a 'devastating blow' for singer

image.altText: A satellite image of the White House from above, with the East Wing demolished

props.synopsis: The demolition has sparked angry backlash from Democrats and raised questions about whether the Trump administration followed proper protocols.

title.children: Satellite images show the White House's East Wing has been demolished

image.altText: Trump raises his eyebrows and points ahead

props.synopsis: The government shutdown is continuing in the US and some of the worst effects are yet to be felt.

title.children: Trump has overseen the two longest US government shutdowns in history

image.altText: A grinning Barnaby Joyce holds a lump of coal in the House of Representatives

props.synopsis: Threatening to euthanase Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's dogs, repeatedly calling out "caaarp" in parliament, that notorious moment on a Canberra footpath, Barnaby Joyce's career has had plenty of colour and movement.

title.children: From Pistol and Boo to leaked texts, Joyce has always run his own race

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie sits in front of a wall that has 'National Press Club of Australia' written on it.

props.synopsis: The man tasked with reviewing Australia's environment laws back when the opposition leader was minister, says he is "bitterly disappointed" she is pushing back on the reforms.

title.children: Ley lashed for opposition to environmental reforms by key report author

image.altText: Two AFLW players in blue and black celebrate a win

props.synopsis: Indy Tahau breaks the AFLW home-and-away season goal-kicking record in Port's breakthrough seven-point defeat of Adelaide.

title.children: Power stun Crows as Tahau breaks AFLW goal-kicking record

image.altText: Mobile vision of two people descending down a crane to a street.

props.synopsis: Video shared widely on social media appears to show alleged Louvre jewellery thieves escaping on a crane near the Seine.

title.children: New video appears to show alleged Louvre thieves escaping in broad daylight

image.altText: Close up of girl's face with large bump on forehead.

props.synopsis: More than a year after her 21-month-old child was hit by an e-bike, a Newcastle mother is calling for change.

title.children: Mother calls for tougher laws after toddler run down by e-bike

image.altText: Thi Kim Tran in a grey jumper, smiling in a picture, holding a light brown bunny.

props.synopsis: The alleged murder of a woman who was stripped naked, bound and gagged before she was killed shows a wider trend that Sydney's "guns for hire" are willing to break gangland code, a senior NSW detective says.

title.children: 'Big, big trouble': Police warn kill crews not abiding by gangland code

image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price and her husband walk into a building with serious expressions.

props.synopsis: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price testifies in her own Federal Court defamation trial in Darwin, following cross-examination from the head of the Central Land Council.

title.children: Senator stands by press release at centre of defamation trial
